HEADING_ADDITIONAL_STORAGE_DESC: Disks for your music library and automount. Assign a Volumio label, repair a partition, or prepare a new disk (init and create partition).
HEADING_VOLUMIO_OS_STORAGE_DESC: The system you boot from or another Volumio installation to recover. Check and fix partitions, or resize the data partition.
SECTION_ASSIGN_LABEL_DESC: Your disk is already partitioned and formatted. Select disk and partition, choose a Volumio label, then Set label. Rescan My Music or reboot to use.
SECTION_REPAIR_DESC: Check or repair the filesystem on a partition. The partition will be unmounted during the operation. Do not use the disk until it finishes.
SECTION_MANAGE_DISK_DESC: New disk or re-prepare: init (destroy all), then create a single partition and format. Label is set so Volumio can mount it.
REFRESH_DISKS_DOC: Reload the list of disks and partitions.
SELECT_DISK_DOC: Select a disk (only non-boot disks are listed).
SELECT_DISK_MANAGE_DOC: Select the disk to init or to create a partition on.
SELECT_PARTITION_DOC: Select the partition to assign a label to.
SELECT_PARTITION_REPAIR_DOC: Select the partition to check or repair.
INIT_DISK_DOC: Create a new partition table. This erases all data on the selected disk. A confirmation will be shown.
NEW_FORMAT_DOC: Filesystem type for the new partition.
CREATE_PARTITION_DOC: Create a single partition on the selected disk and format it with the chosen type. Label will be set to issd so Volumio can mount it.
NEW_LABEL_DOC: Label recognized by Volumio: issd, ihdd, Internal SSD, Internal HDD. Only labels not already in use are listed.
SET_LABEL_DOC: Set the selected partition's label. Unmounts the partition, sets the label, then you can rescan.
RUN_FSCK_DOC: Run filesystem check/repair on the selected partition. The partition will be unmounted during the operation. Do not use the disk until it finishes.
ERR_SELECT_PARTITION_AND_LABEL: Select a partition and a label.
USB_LABEL_DOC: Only for USB or external disks. Enter a custom name (e.g. USB or MyDrive). For internal disks use the Volumio label above.
MANAGE_USB_LABEL_DOC: When the selected disk is USB, this label is used. Leave empty for "USB". Do not use internal labels.
ERR_USB_LABEL_REQUIRED: USB disks need a custom label (e.g. USB or a name). Do not use internal labels.
ERR_USB_NO_INTERNAL_LABEL: USB disks must not use internal labels (issd, ihdd, Internal SSD, Internal HDD). Use a different label.
SECTION_OS_MAINTENANCE_DESC: Check and fix Volumio OS partitions on the boot device (e.g. MicroSD). Status is shown below. Useful after power loss.
OS_MAINT_CHECK_AND_FIX_DOC: Unmount each partition, run filesystem check/repair, then remount. Do not power off.
OS_MAINT_NO_BOOT_DISK: No Volumio boot disk detected (only applies when running from internal/SD storage).
OS_MAINT_NO_PARTITIONS: No partitions found on boot device
OS_MAINT_FIX_TITLE: Checking and fixing Volumio OS partitions
OS_MAINT_FIX_DONE: All partitions checked. You can use the system again.
OS_MAINT_ANOTHER_HINT: To fix another Volumio installation (recovery), select it above and click Check and fix all.
OS_MAINT_TARGET_DOC: This system = device you booted from. Or select another Volumio installation (e.g. USB) to recover.
SECTION_DATA_RESIZE_DESC: If automatic resize did not complete on the boot device, you can resize the data partition to use the full disk.
DATA_RESIZE_BTN_DOC: Grow the data partition to use all free space. Do not power off.
DATA_RESIZE_NO_PARTITION: No Volumio data partition (volumio_data) found. This applies only to the boot device.
DATA_RESIZE_NEEDED: Resize needed – automatic resize did not complete.
DATA_RESIZE_OK: OK – data partition is using full size.
DATA_RESIZE_ALREADY_FULL: Data partition is already at full size. No action needed.
DATA_RESIZE_DONE: Data partition resized to full size.
DATA_RESIZE_ANOTHER_HINT: To resize another Volumio installation, select it above and click Resize to 100%.
DATA_RESIZE_TARGET_DOC: This system = device you booted from. Or select another Volumio installation to resize its data partition.
